title: Number of cigarettes smoked daily in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2015
summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Number of cigarettes, and Share of respondents in each Number of cigarettes on the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has 12.0 times more Share of respondents than Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 which is has the lowest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 8 number of Number of cigarettess.
The Share of respondents is highest at Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 and lowest at Number of cigarettes 31 to 50.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Number of cigarettes, and Share of respondents in each Number of cigarettes on the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has 12.0 times more Share of respondents than Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 which is has the lowest.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
The highest Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has 22.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Number of cigarettes 31 to 50.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 is higher than any other Number of cigarettess with value 24.0, followed by 1 to 5, and 11 to 15. Down to Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 with the lowest value 2.0.
The Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has 1.86 times more Share of respondents than average.
Summing up the values of all Number of cigarettess, we get total 103.0.
